item.title: I see you I hear you I will work to change policy to protect...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I see you
I hear you
I will work to change policy to protect you.

Itâ€™s long overdue that we teach comprehensive sex education starting with our youngest learners, we work on dismantling the current dress code, and that we teach a mandatory consent program in our schools.

The demand for change comes after several allegations of sexual assault surfaced this week against several East High School students.

denver.cbslocal.com

100+ High School Students In Denver Protest For Better Sex Education Amid Sex Assault Allegations

The demand for change comes after several allegations of sexual assault surfaced this week against several East High School students.The demand for change comes after several allegations of sexual assault surfaced this week against several East High School students.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: As we enter the 2020 - 2021 school year, Director Anderson is...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

As we enter the 2020 - 2021 school year, Director Anderson is re-establishing his community cabinet.

This is a space for parents, organizations, students, educators and community members to have a seat at the table and help influence policy. This group will help set Director Andersons' 2020-2021 goals as a member of the Denver School Board.

https://forms.gle/8Yp3tfKApcr5fmvE9

item.title: Heâ€™d moved to Colorado from Kansas on the night of President...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Heâ€™d moved to Colorado from Kansas on the night of President Barack Obamaâ€™s re-election in 2012, at age 14.

Seven years later, he celebrated his own election-night victory, winning a seat on the Denver school board and becoming the youngest Black elected official in CO history.

The confluence of COVID-19 and this summer's Black Lives Matter protests brought a new generation of Black leaders to the forefront of Mile High City politics and activism.

5280.com

How Twin Pandemics Transformed Denver's Black Leadership - 5280

The confluence of COVID-19 and this summer's Black Lives Matter protests brought a new generation of Black leaders to the forefront of Mile High City politics and activism.The confluence of COVID-19 and this summer's Black Lives Matter protests brought a new generation of Black leaders to the forefront of Mile High City politics and activism.
item.author: Tay Anderson

Hello, I am Director Tay Anderson my pronouns are He, Him, and His. ðŸ’›

item.title: When this idea came before me I said we need to take a poll...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

When this idea came before me I said we need to take a poll among our staff before asking them to come back to work.

Chalkbeat Colorado

Public health metrics are moving in the right direction, and Denver Public Schools is considering an earlier return for some elementary students.

All details TBD.

Check here for Colorado updates to school reopening plans.

item.title: Take advantage of this opportunity!
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Take advantage of this opportunity!

Chalkbeat Colorado

While the cost is $10 per day per child for most families, the program is free for families at 11 schools that received grant funding.

The program is open to Denver students ages 5 to 12. It costs $10 per child per day.

co.chalkbeat.org

Denver schools are offering four hours of supervision for remote learning. Thereâ€™s still room.

item.title: It comes as a great shockâ€¦to discover that the flag to which...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

It comes as a great shockâ€¦to discover that the flag to which you have pledged allegianceâ€¦has not pledged allegiance to you.

- James Baldwin

FOX31 KDVR.com

Denver Public Schools meetings have changed since the COVID-19 pandemic, but not just by going virtual. DPS stopped saying the Pledge of Allegiance back in February.

DENVER (KDVR) â€” Saturday morning, Tay Anderson tweeted a reply to Trump about the Pledge of Allegiance saying, â€œI got the School Board to ditch it all together. â€” â€œWith liberty and justice foâ€¦

kdvr.com

DPS stops saying Pledge of Allegiance, choose other ways to inspire meetings

item.title: Today has been a hard one, but wanted to tell my community THANK...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today has been a hard one, but wanted to tell my community THANK YOU FOR THE WORDS OF SUPPORT & LOVE.

Even if we donâ€™t agree on policy, I love you back.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I have never wished death on anyone and I wake up every morning...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I have never wished death on anyone and I wake up every morning wondering if this will be my last.

I get sick thinking if my mother will be forced to join other black mothers in burying her child.

No matter what happens to me, I love my community even if you donâ€™t love me.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways â€” I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences â€” I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson
